spell.name: Air Bubble

components.m: a soap bubble of bubble of sea foam

entries: Für die Dauer des Zaubers bist du vollständig in einer Luftblase eingeschlossen. Die Blase ist eine Kugel, die sich in einem Radius von 10 Fuß um dich herum ausbreitet, sich mit dir bewegt und vollständig transparent und durchlässig für Kreaturen, Waffen, Gegenstände, Objekte, Zauber und Terrarin ist, von denen nichts die Blase zum Platzen bringt. Alle Kreaturen, die sich innerhalb der Blase befinden, können frische Luft atmen, unabhängig davon, was sich außerhalb der Blase befindet.

Sollte die Blase in Flüssigkeit getaucht sein, können Kreaturen innerhalb der Blase nicht schwimmen. Stattdessen können Kreaturen, die sich nicht in der Blase befinden, ihre normale Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit nutzen, um die Blase zu verlassen, und solange sie sich mit dir in der Blase befinden, bewegen sich befreundete Kreaturen mit der Blase. Die Blase schwimmt standardmäßig halb unter der Oberfläche von Flüssigkeiten, und du kannst deine normale Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit benutzen, um die Blase horizontal in jede Richtung zu bewegen.

Du kannst die Blase auch mit einer Bonusaktion zum Schweben oder Sinken bringen. Eine schwebende oder sinkende Blase steigt oder sinkt am Ende deines Zuges langsam 30 Fuß, bis du mit dem Boden, einem anderen festen Gegenstand oder der Flüssigkeitsoberfläche in Berührung kommst. Solltest du auf einer festen Oberfläche unter einer Flüssigkeit landen, kannst du dich mit deiner normalen Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit über diesen Boden bewegen, wobei die Blase und andere freundliche Kreaturen wie gewohnt mit dir reisen.

Die Blase kann verwendet werden, um gefahrlos in Säure oder andere ätzende oder giftige Flüssigkeiten einzutauchen, ohne Schaden zu nehmen. Lava oder jede andere Flüssigkeit, die aufgrund von Hitze, Kälte oder magischen Eigenschaften Schaden verursachen würde, fügt demjenigen, der sich in der Blase befindet, immer noch Schaden zu, aber der Schaden wird um die Hälfte reduziert.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Wenn du diesen Zauber mit einem Zauberslot der Stufe 4 oder höher wirkst, erhöht sich die Dauer der Konzentration auf bis zu 24 Stunden, und die Blase breitet sich in einem Radius von 20 Fuß aus.

spell.name: Aquabolt
entries: Du beschwörst eine Kugel aus turbulentem Wasser und schleuderst sie auf deine Feinde. Führe einen Fernkampfzauberangriff gegen eine Kreatur in Reichweite aus. Bei einem Treffer erleidet diese Kreatur {@dice 1d6} Blugeonenschaden und wird, falls sie größer oder kleiner ist, 5 Fuß zurückgestoßen.
Der Schaden dieses Zaubers erhöht sich um {@dice 1d6}, wenn du die 5. Stufe ({@dice 2d6}), die 11. Stufe ({@dice 3d6}) und die 17. Stufe ({@dice 4d6}) erreichst.

spell.name: Bigby's Blistering Barnacles

components.m: a single barnacle and a droplet of lye

entries: Wähle eine Kreatur, die du in Reichweite sehen kannst. Das Ziel muss einen Rettungswurf auf Konstitution bestehen oder wird für die Dauer des Zaubers von Kopf bis Fuß mit Seepocken unterschiedlicher Größe bedeckt. Solange die Kreatur mit Seepocken bedeckt ist, hat sie einen Nachteil bei Angriffen, Rettungswürfen für Geschicklichkeit und Charisma-Proben. Am Ende jeder Runde, in der die Kreatur noch mit Seepocken bedeckt ist, erleidet sie {@dice 1d6} Säureschaden. Eine Kreatur, die sich im Umkreis von 5 Fuß um das Ziel des Zauberspruches befindet, kann versuchen, die Seepocken zu entfernen, indem sie eine Aktion einsetzt, um eine Stärkeüberprüfung gegen den Schutz-DC des Zauberspruches zu machen. Wenn diese Prüfung erfolgreich ist, endet der Zauber.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Wenn du diesen Zauber mit einem Zauberslot der Stufe 3 oder höher wirkst, erhöht sich der durch diesen Zauber verursachte Säureschaden um {@dice 1d6} für jeden Slot über der Stufe 2.

spell.name: Bless Vessel

m.text: a bottle of wine or other spirits worth at least 10 gp, which this spell consumes

entries: Als Teil dieses Zaubers berührst du ein zu Wasser oder in der Luft befindliches Gefährt, auf dem du dich gerade befindest. Für die Dauer dieses Zaubers wird die Geschwindigkeit dieses Fahrzeugs mit 1,5 multipliziert, und ti ignoriert Bewegungseinschränkungen durch Gebiete mit schwierigem Terrain (oder ähnlichem). Einmal vor dem Ende dieses Zaubers kann ein Charakter, der sich auf oder in dem Fahrzeug befindet, wählen, ob er einen Vorteil bei einer Prüfung oder einem Rettungswurf haben möchte, der das Fahrzeug vor Schaden bewahrt. Ein Fahrzeug kann immer nur von einer Instanz dieses Zaubers profitieren.

spell.name: Cresting Waves
entries: With a gesture, you summon a roaring wave of water to buffet a creature within range. Target a creature within range, and make a ranged spell attack against the create and against two other creatures within 10 feet of your chosen target. Any creature hit by this attack takes {@dice 3d4} bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 10 feet away from you in a direction you choose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage done by this spell increases by {@dice 1d4} and the distance pushed increases by up to 5 feet, for each slot level above 1st. You may also make a ranged spell attack against one additional creature within 10 feet of the target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Depthsurge
entries: You conjure a powerful explosion of water, scattering creatures affected by it. Choose a point within range. Creatures within a 10-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Strength saving throw. If a creature fails this saving throw, it takes {@dice 4d10} bludgeoning damage, and is knocked 15 feet away from the center of this explosion, and is rendered prone. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw takes half damage and is subject to no other effects from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage done by this spell increases by {@dice 1d10} and the distance pushed increases by 5 feet, for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Flowsight

components.m: the eyestalk of a sea snail

entries: You touch a willing living creature, granting it the ability to extend its senses through a body of water or other liquid, even as small as a puddle or as large and interspaced as an area of falling rain, the creature knows the exact location of everything the body of liquid touches, up to a maximum distance of 120 feet. This sense can even detect creatures or obstacles that are invisible and in contact with the liquid, and can instantly discern illusions immersed in the liquid for what they actually are.

spell.name: Geyser
entries: Choose a point on the ground within range. A geyser with a base of 5 feet by 5 feet and a height of 10 feet erupts from this point. If a creature sized Large or smaller is on top of this point, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. If it succeeds, the creature moves to the closest avaiable space of its choice not occupied by the geyser. If the creature fails this saving throw, however, it takes {@dice 3d6} bludgeoning damage, is rendered prone, and is carried to the top of the geyser.

The geyser clocks line of sight, and creatures within or at the top of the geyser are both swimming and in difficult terrain. The geyser lasts until the end of your next turn, at which point it recedes into the earth. Any creatures still atop or within the geyser when this happens immediately begin falling, and take damage from this fall as normal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage done by this spell increases by {@dice 1d6} and the height of the geyser increases by up to 10feet, for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Luck of the Sea
entries: As part of this spell, you must touch a fishing rod, harpoon, spear, trident, net, or other fishing supplies. If the affected item is used to fish for at least an hour, within the next 24 hours, it catches an additional {@dice 2d10} worth of mackerel or similar local tiny-sized fish, as well as {@dice 1d4-2} trinkets from the Trinker table on page 160 of the Player's Handbook (minimum 0). Eating one of these additional fish restores 1 hit point, and the fish provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
The fish lose their potenct if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.

spell.name: Mordenkainen's Capable Caravel

m.text: a small model carvel worth 2,500 gp that is fully inside a bottle

entries: You conjure into existence a caravel at any point within range that is on top of a large enough body of water to accommodate it. You decide the general appearance of this ship when you conjure it, but it is always made of wood and has roughly the same proportions. This ship can comfortably host up to 20 creatures and 250,000 lbs of cargo, and travels at roughly 4 miles per hour when crewed with at least four creatures.

After the duration of this spell expires, the ship begins to vanish over the course of a minute unless you immediately cast this spell again. This ship must still be within the spell's range of you for you to be able to cast this spell in this way.

spell.name: Pressure Sphere

m.text: a small hollow crystal globe worth 1,000 gp containing pressurized pure water

entries: A sphere of crushing water forms around the head (or similar) of a creature you can see within range, and begins to exert an incredible force upon that creature. When you first cast this spell, the creature affected by it takes {@dice 6d10} bludgeoning damage. As a bonus action on any of your turns for the spell's duration, you may cause the creature to take this damage again. A creature under the effect of this spell is considered to be holding its breath (and eventually suffocating) as described under the rules for suffocating on page 189 of the Player's Handbook, unless the creature is able to breathe water.

On its turn, a creature under the effects of this spell may attempt to pull itself from the sphere as an action. If it does so, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or remain stuck in the sphere. Once a creature removes itself from the sphere, the spell ends.

spell.name: Red Tide
entries: Choose a point within range that is either or or within a body of water, or on solid ground. A torrent of frothing red water issues forth, mercilessly battering all creatures within a 5 foot tall, 20 foot radius cylinder centered on that point. Creatures within this area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 2d10} bludgeoning and {@dice 2d10} poison damage if they fail this save, and half that amount if they succeed. A creature that fails this saving throw is also poisoned until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage or the poison damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Ripple
entries: You pull into existence a circular ribbon of water which wraps around you and rapidly expands outward. Each creature within range, other than you, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage and have disadvantage on opportunity attacks against you until the start of their next turn.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4})

spell.name: Riptide
entries: You conjure a vicious wave that attempts to drag down and pull a creature no greater than large size that you choose within range. This creature must attempt a Strength saving throw. If it fails, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage, is rendered prone, and is pulled up to 30 feet closer to you in a straight line. If the creature succeeds on this saving throw, it takes half of this damage and is neither pulled nor rendered prone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sink

components.m: a handful of powdered stone mixed with water

entries: You indicate a creature within range, which must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, for the spell's duration that creature loses any natural buoyancy it may have in liquid, and if it ends its turn in any liquid it begins to sink by 20 feet per round (if it wouldn't naturally sink a greater distance already). If the creature has a swimming speed, the distance of that speed is halved for the spell's duration. A creature under the effect of this spell may try to not sink by taking an action to attempt a Strength (Athletics) check with a DC equal to your spell save DC. If it succeeds, the creature does not sink this turn, while it continues to sink unaffected on a failure. A creature without a swimming speed makes this check with disadvantage.

spell.name: Swim

components.m: a single fin or scale from a fish

entries: You touch a living creature, granting it a swimming speed equal to its normal movement speed plus 10 feet for the spell's duration. If the creature already has a swimming speed greater than this amount, the spell has no effect on them. A creature affected by this spell may experience it as a non-visible magical benefit, or the spell may temporarily cause them to grow webbing between their fingers and toes, at the caster's discretion. This spell does not confer the ability to breathe in water, and creatures that can only breathe air must still do so.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, it can affect one additional creature within range for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Torrent

components.m: a ring inset with a motif of crashing waves

entries: A blast of roaring water issues from your hand in a direction you choose, occupying a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails this save takes {@dice 2d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and is pushed to an available space of its choice within 5 feet of the end of this line. A creature that succeeds on this save takes half as much damage and is not pushed back.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Urchin's Spines

components.m: a sea urchin spine, sweing needle, pine needle, or similar

entries: A willing creature that you touch sprouts clusters of 3 inch long purple or black spines along its entire body. Any time a spined creature is the target of a melee attack, a spell with a range of touch (not including this one), or an ability that requires touching the spined creature, the targeting creature takes {@dice 1d6} piercing and {@dice 1d6} poison damage. Creatures affected by this spell have disadvantage on Charisma checks besides Intimidation checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, either the piercing or poison damage (you choose) icreases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Water Tentacle

components.m: a water source, such as a vial of water

entries: You create a watery tentacle at a point you choose within range on top of solid ground or a body of water. This tentacle is size medium, has an AC of 13 and 30 hit points, has resistance to fire damage and to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical sources, and is vulnerable to cold damage. The tentacle uses your spellcasting ability score and modifier in place of its Strength score and modifier, but otherwise uses your statistics for determining its saving throws. This tentacle disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, or when the spell ends.

When you first cast this spell, you can cause the ten-tacle to make a melee spell attack with your statistics against a creature within 10 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the tentacle to move up to 15 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 10 feet of it. If the tentacle's attack hits, you may direct it to grapple a target instead of dealing damage. If it does, any attempts to escape the grapple are made against your spellcasting ability modifier plus your proficiency bonus.

You may also use an action on your turn to direct the tentacle to act in accordance to your somatic gestures, performing functions such as lifting objects or moving up to 15 feet, but the tentacle will not attack unless you command it to do so with a bonus action, as above.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the hit points of the tentacle increase by 10 and the damage of spell's attack increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.
